paper_title.en: Effect of Al2O3 seeding on growth of Bi-based whiskers in glassy quenched platelet method

description.en: We grew Bi2Sr2Can-1CunOy (Bi-based) whiskers using various particle sizes and concentrations of Al2O3. We found that the growth rate of the Bi-based whiskers was dependent on the concentrations and the thickness of seeding Al2O3 particles in the grassy quenched platelet. The resistance-temperature and current-voltage characteristics indicated that the grown Bi-based whiskers had the critical temperature T-c of about 85 K and the critical current I-c of about 150 mA at 44 K and 0 T, which corresponds to the critical current density of 2 x 10(5) A/cm(2). (c) 2005 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Growth of Bi-2212 single crystals by a vertical Bridgman method using large crucibles

description.en: Bi2Sr2CaCu2O8+delta (Bi-2212) superconducting single crystals were prepared by a modified vertical Bridgman method using large crucibles of a 30 mm external diameter with a cone-shaped bottom. In order to obtain a large single crystal with high crystallinity, we optimized the growth conditions, where the large crucibles were used. As a result, we could obtain a large plate-like single crystal with a size of 17.0 x 5.5 mm(2) when the rotation speed of crucible and the starting temperature of melt for crystal growth were 50 rpm and 1000 degrees C, respectively. The full width at half maximum value of the (00 (10) under bar) X-ray diffraction peak due to Bi-2212 was small with about 0.06 degrees. Moreover, the critical temperature (T-c) of the single crystals was about 87 K, which was higher than the T-c of the single crystals grown with the crucibles whose external diameter was by 30% smaller than that of the large crucibles. (c) 2005 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Superconducting characterization of non-superconductors/high-T-C cuprate superconductors

description.en: We deposited the ferromagnetic films, nickel (Ni) or iron (Fe), on high-T-C cuprate superconductor, YBa2Cu3O6+delta (YBCO) thin film, by rf magnetron sputtering technique, and investigated the effect of Ni- and Fe-deposition on the superconducting characteristics. From the results, we found that the zero-resistance transition temperature (T-C) and the critical current (I-C) of Ni/YBCO and Fe/YBCO samples decreased with increasing the thickness of ferromagnetic films in both cases of Ni and Fe. This indicates that it is possible to form a Josephson junction based on high-T-C cuprate superconductors by simpler method. (c) 2005 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Effect of magnetic field during deposition on growth of Bi2Sr2Can-1CunOy superconducting films

description.en: We deposited Bi2Sr2Can-1CunOy (Bi-based) superconducting thin films by a RF magnetron sputtering method applying external magnetic field. The as-deposited films were Bi-2223 single-phase, and their T-c was about 70 K without any in situ or ex situ annealing process. The relation between Tc and magnetic fields was clarified. In addition, the effect of arrangement of magnets on the T-c and the composition of the films was clarified. (c) 2005 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Enlargement effect of the crucible size on Bi2Sr2CaCu2Oy single crystals grown by a modified vertical Bridgman method

description.en: Bi2Sr2CaCu2Oy (Bi-2212) superconducting single crystals were prepared by a modified vertical Bridgman method using large alumina crucibles of a 26 mm bore diameter with cone-shaped bottom. In order to obtain large and high quality single crystals, we optimized growth conditions using the large crucibles. We obtained a large plate-like single crystal with a size of 17.0 mm x 5.5 mm when the crystal growth was carried out with the rotation speed of 50 rpm and at the temperature for starting the crystal growth of 1000 degrees C. In the single crystal, the FWHM value of the (0010) x-ray diffraction peak which was assigned to a Bi-2212 superconductor was small and about 0.06 degrees. T-c of the single crystal was about 87 K, which was higher than T-c = 82 K of the single crystals grown with smaller crucibles whose bore diameter is 35% less than the large crucibles.

paper_title.en: Deposition of Bi2Sr2Can-1CunOy (Bi-based) superconducting thin films by rf magnetron sputtering method under external magnetic field

description.en: We deposited Bi2Sr2Can-1CunOy (Bi-based) superconducting thin films by rf magnetron sputtering method under external magnetic field, and investigated the effect of the external magnetic field on the growth and the superconductivity of the thin films. From the results, we found that the superconducting transition temperatures (T.) of the Bi-based thin films were improved by applying the external magnetic field during film deposition. The thin film with the highest T-c was produced by this method and showed the zero-resistance by the about 70 K without any annealing processes.

paper_title.en: Growth of high quality Bi(2)Sr(2)CaCu(2)Oy single crystals by the modified vertical Bridgman method

description.en: We grew Bi2Sr2CaCu2Oy (Bi-2212) single crystals by the modified vertical Bridgman (VB) method, and investigated their characteristics in order to clarify the optimum growth conditions for obtaining high-quality Bi-2212 single crystals. The Bi-2212 single crystals were grown changing pulling rates or using starting materials after pre-treatments. We found that the superconducting critical temperature (T-c) of the single crystal prepared at a slow growth rate of 0.25 mm/h was about 88 K and that the single crystals were a Bi-2212 single phase. Moreover, the single crystals grown using the starting materials pre-treated in Ar and O-2 atmospheres, had the T-c of about 88 and 86 K, respectively. In addition, both of single crystals were Bi-2212 single phase. (C) 2004 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Chemical properties of the Bi-based superconducting whiskers studied by X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy

description.en: We investigated the chemical bond nature of the constituent elements in the surface of the as-grown Bi2Sr2Can-1CunOy (Bi-based) superconducting whiskers by a high-resolution X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy. From the results, we found that lots of the impurities, e.g. carbon, hydroxyl and so on were adsorbed or absorbed on the surface of the as-grown whiskers. Moreover, the valence of the Cu in CuO2 plane which is important for superconductivity has changed from divalent to less than divalent, which leads to the existence of the insulating layers in the surface of the Bi-based superconducting whiskers. (C) 2004 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Growth mechanism of Bi-based whiskers in a method of Al2O3-seeded quenched glassy platelets

description.en: We prepared the Bi2Sr2Can-1CunOy (Bi-based) whiskers by a method of Al2O3-seeded quenched glassy platelets, changing atmospheres of growth. It is very important to seed Al2O3 particles on the surface of the glassy platelets in order the whiskers to grow at higher rate. From the results, we found that the growth rates and the critical temperatures of the whiskers were independent of oxygen gas flow rates, whereas the critical current density was dependent on such parameters. In addition, the superconducting property of the whiskers was affected by oxygen partial pressures, and the whiskers did not grow in Ar gas. (C) 2004 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
